description: Smallest starting prime for n consecutive primes in arithmetic progression.
comments: The primes following a(5) and a(6) occur at a(n)+30*k, k=0..(n-1). a(6) was found by Lander and Parkin. The next term requires a spacing >= 210. The expected size is a(7) > 10^21 (see link). - _Hugo Pfoertner_, Jun 25 2004[Daniel Forgues, Jan 17 2011]: (Start)It is conjectured that there are arithmetic progressions of n consecutive primes, for any n.Common differences of first and smallest AP of n >= 1 consecutive primes: {0, 1, 2, 6, 30, 30, >= 210, >= 210, >= 210, >= 210, >= 2310, ...} (End)
references: L. J. Lander and T. R. Parkin, Consecutive Primes in Arithmetic Progression. Math. Comput. 21, 489, 1967.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
